title: How to Hide Your Real Name on PayPal (Using a Business Account)

steps.title: Create a new email address for your business.
steps.content: Create a new email address for your business. To create a business account, you'll need to make sure you're using an email address that doesn't have your real name attached to it. This ensures that nothing about your account will accidentally display your real name to the people you exchange money with. You will need to upload proof of your business name when using this method. So, if you don't actually have a business, you won't be able to hide your real name in PayPal with this method. Creating a new email address also allows you to keep your personal account open, which means you can continue using it with the people you don't mind knowing your real name. If you do use the same email address, PayPal will close your personal account and you'll only have your business account. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Sign in to PayPal and click the gear icon.
steps.content: Sign in to PayPal and click the gear icon. It's at the top-right corner. This takes you to your Settings.

steps.title: Click Upgrade to a Business account.
steps.content: Click Upgrade to a Business account . It's toward the bottom of the left panel. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Select Use a new email with your business account.
steps.content: Select Use a new email with your business account . It's the first option. This ensures you don't close your personal account. Alternatively, you can choose Use your current email address to switch to a business account if you donâ€™t mind closing your personal account.

steps.title: Click the blue Next button.
steps.content: Click the blue Next button. It's at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Enter your email address and click Continue.
steps.content: Enter your email address and click Continue . Now you'll be asked to provide details about your business.

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to create your business account.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to create your business account. During the setup process , you'll be asked to enter your business name (make sure it's something you don't want to hide), your contact information, and some basic information about your business. [3] X Research source Once your business account is created, you can use that to send and receive payments with PayPal instead of the account connected to your real name. You will be asked for your employer ID or sole proprietor ID. This is for tax purposes. If you don't have one, enter your social security number. After creating your business account, you can link your regular bank account . Even though your real name is connected to your bank account, nobody you do business with will see your name or banking information.

steps.title: Go to https://www.paypal.com/businessmanage/account/aboutBusiness.
steps.content: Go to https://www.paypal.com/businessmanage/account/aboutBusiness . If your real name still shows up on your invoices even though you're using a business account, you might need to change some settings to hide it. You may be prompted to provide documentation of your business name. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Click Update.
steps.content: Click Update . It's to the right of your business name.

steps.title: Click Edit.
steps.content: Click Edit . You'll see this option in the top right corner of your business profile.

steps.title: Click Change.
steps.content: Click Change . Find this under your business name in your profile.

steps.title: Select "Your contact name has changed" and click Continue.
steps.content: Select "Your contact name has changed" and click Continue . This might say "Your business name has changed" instead. Follow the on-screen instructions to submit your name change request. You can only deposit money from your business account into a bank account with a matching business name.

steps.title: It is not possible to hide your name from a PayPal Seller Profile.
steps.content: It is not possible to hide your name from a PayPal Seller Profile. If you have a Seller Profile for selling goods and services on PayPal, your real name or business name will always appear. You can hide your phone number, email address, or location, but not your name. [5] X Research source To hide other information from your Seller Profile: Go to https://www.paypal.com/myaccount/settings/account to open your account settings. Select your seller profile and click Manage . If you're using the mobile app, tap your profile icon and select Seller Profile instead. Click Edit and hide the elements you don't want to appear on your Seller Profile or invoices. Tap Save to save your changes. [6] X Research source
